text: Whenever the Commission shall believe that any rate or charge of any public utility may be unreasonable or unjustly discriminatory, or that any reasonable service is not supplied by a public utility, or that an investigation of any matter relating to any public utility should for any reason be made, it may, on its own motion, summarily investigate the same with or without notice.
historical:
Prior Codifications

1981 Ed., § 43-615.

1973 Ed., § 43-414.

Effect of Amendments

D.C. Law 13-107 substituted "rate or charge of any public utility" for "rate or charge", and substituted "supplied by a public utility" for "supplied".

Legislative History of Laws

For Law 13-107, see notes following § 34-908.
